title: Jurgen Klopp insists he would not be satisfied with a point as Liverpool bid to pile more pressure on Man City
text:
Sport Jurgen Klopp insists he would not be satisfied with a point as Liverpool bid to pile more pressure on Man City "Usually, you go to City, and you can get a point... should I already be satisfied with this? No. I’m not," said the Reds boss Share Klopp has urged his side to go all guns blazing at Man City (Photo: Liverpool FC) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool can deliver the knock out blow that could end Pep Guardiola’s season... if they’re brave enough. 
That’s the message Jurgen Klopp will deliver to his fired-up players as they head to Manchester City in search of the victory that will not only make his team red hot favourites to make the top four, but seriously damage their opponents’ hopes of doing the same. 
It is a crucial, pivotal showdown in the race for the Champions’ League, and with City reeling after their midweek European disaster, Klopp will order his side to go for the throat to snatch the win that could send Guardiola’s side into crisis. 
Defeat for City would put them under intense pressure and could so easily undermine their top four hopes, and Klopp said: “We have to deliver. We only go there to get something. 
"Usually, you go to City, and you can get a point... should I already be satisfied with this? No. I’m not. Guardiola watched his side to crash out of Europe in midweek (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Klopp wants his side to go for all three points at the Etihad (Photo: Reuters) 
“I don’t think about it this way. I really think about what we have to do - we will go there and try to win.” 
Klopp acknowledges that victory for his side would pile even more pressure on their direct opponents for a top four place... but he is painfully aware too that talking about it, won’t make it any easier. 
Asked if he was looking to pile further misery on Guardiola after his miserable week, the Reds boss replied: 
“Could I put them under pressure with words? Should I start? 
“The only way to do it is focus on our own game. If the table was only the top six we would be in a better position so obviously we have not done a lot wrong against these teams. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
